shortdesc.ph: Pushes external raw video frame to the SDK via video track.

p.codeblock: public abstract int pushExternalVideoFrameById(VideoFrame frame, int videoTrackId);

section.p:
To publish a custom video source, follow these steps:
Call to create a video track and get the video track ID.
Call joinChannel to join the channel. In , set customVideoTrackId to the video track ID and set publishCustomVideoTrack to .
Call pushExternalVideoFrameById and set videoTrackId to the ID from step 2 to publish the corresponding custom video source in the channel. You can push video frames by calling pushExternalVideoFrameById or pushExternalVideoFrameById (with parameter). The difference is that this method supports video data in Texture format.
section.note:
If you only need to push one custom video source to the channel, you can directly call , and the SDK will automatically create a video track with videoTrackId 0. Danger: After calling this method, even if you stop pushing external video frames to the SDK, the custom video stream will still be counted toward video duration and incur charges. Agora recommends taking appropriate actions based on your use case to avoid such charges:
If you no longer need to capture external video, call to destroy the custom video track.
If you only want to use external video for local preview and not publish it to the channel, call to stop sending the video stream, or call and set publishCustomVideoTrack to .

plentry.pd: The video frame to be pushed.
The video track ID returned by . If you only need to push one custom video source, set videoTrackId to 0.
